subject: Personal Finance
title: Overconfidence and Risk
description: A 60-second lesson on Overconfidence and Risk.

hook.text: Ask 100 drivers if they're above average. About 90 say yes. The math doesn't work.

buildup.text: Overconfidence makes us believe we predict outcomes better than we actually can.

discovery.text: Day traders who trade most often earn the lowest returns on average.

twist.text: Expertise makes it worse. The more you know, the more confident and often wrong you become.

climax.text: Even Buffett warns against overconfidence. He calls humility an investor's best friend.

quiz.question: What happens to day traders who trade most frequently?
options: They tend to earn lower returns
